I used this update and while I am sure it is good, no matter what options I chose in the new video menu my game kept freezing every few seconds. It is not m system btw, it exceeds recommended specs for this game. 

If anyone else is experiencing this and knows what I should do, would appreciate a comment.

In the mean time I've reverted back to before the patch, I did so by backing up the following files before running the update.

All files (not folders) in the Main rage dir
the entire mp folder
and the entire base folder. 

if you backup these files before you update, it will help you revert in case you run into problems like I did. 

btw ty SKIDROW and crew for continued updates, and great game releases.

Don't ask me why, but after playing this game for 10hours with the occasional NPC looking like his atoms were trying to explode then implode and back again I decided I should try certain update and changes once again. (Not to mention the leader of the resistance couldn't hold clipboard to save his life)

1) I updated to the 11.10 AMD preview2 driver found here:
http://support.amd.com/us/kbarticles/Pages/GPU122AMDCat1110PreDriverV2.aspx

2) I used SKIDROW's update 1 patch, 
backing up my files in the rage folder, the entire base and mp folders first. just encase a revert was necessary.

and last I tired something new

3) I used the "ultra" graphic config and command lines setup by "FusedCore" located here:

http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?p=25524360#post25524360


Following his directions, and those other updates, my game runs 100% so far...I'll post again if I discover anything new.

Update:

As I was still getting texture pops I changed all my settings in the video menu... now I've changed them back so everything is set for high quality graphics... I'm still getting the texture pops and a ton of interference on the HUD but it seems to be running perfectly now - no lag, no crashes.

Also, don't Alt-Tab out of the game as you may lose V-Sync.

I'm guessing there'll be another patch before long, we'll just have to wait.

for people who cant use cheats here is what to do:

before installing the new patch, make a copy of the entire Rage folder somewhere on your hdd
install the patch on one of the two copies
make a shortcut for both Rage.exe and add the line for example: D:\Rage\Rage.exe  set com_allowConsole 1

so here's the deal, in the patched rage the cheats dont work and on the non-patched rage they do work
if you were stuck like me in Bash TV without enough bullets, i started the non-patched rage, added these two commands:

Press ` (Tilde) to open the command console in-game. Type these commands to activate the corresponding cheat.

   Godmode: cvarAdd g_permagodmode 1
   Infinite Ammo: cvarAdd g_infiniteAmmo 1

The codes below need to be re-entered after loading into a new area.

   Vehicle Godmode: cvarAdd vehicle_god 1
   Infinite Vehicle Boost: cvarAdd vehicle_infiniteBoost 1
   All Vehicle Upgrades: cvarAdd vehicle_enableAllUpgrades 1

and the miracle of this is, both rage folders saves in the same folder, so when you passed a mission with the cheats enabled
you can go on and play without cheats and the wonders of the new patch and go on with your mission

good luck !!

This update fixed the texture problems for along with me updating to the nvidia beta drivers thanks for the upload.

@RhymesMatter    I had the same problem with vsync turning itself off. Even if I changed 2 other settings at the same time, those 2 would stay changed and vsync would turn itself off again. It turns out that it was my nvidia control panel. Even though I had set the the global vsync setting to "Force on", in the individual program list, rage.exe still had the "Force off" setting active. Changing this one setting from force off to force on fixed this problem for me and now the games runs smooth as butter.

Got it working on mine at last:

I was still getting the "pausing" problem - 
Windows 7 64 ult, Crossfire hd5770's

finally did this AFTER apply update:

1.  Uninstalled ATI (do not reset).

2.  Installed the performance drivers here: 
http://support.amd.com/us/kbarticles/Pages/GPU121AMDCatRagePerfDriver.aspx

3.  Restart.

4.  added a shortcut to desktop with the following in the "target" box under properties:
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Bethesda Softworks\Rage\Rage.exe" +set com_allowconsole 1 +r_swapInterval 1 g_fov 10 +jobs_numThreads 0

5.  loaded a game, pressed "#" too bring up console (or ~) and typed m_smooth 0

Done.  Finally is working - hope this helps someone out.

Got it working on mine at last:

I was still getting the "pausing" problem -

http://support.amd.com/us/kbarticles/Pages/GPU121AMDCatRagePerfDriver.aspx

3.  Restart.

4.  added a shortcut to desktop with the following in the "target" box under properties:
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Bethesda Softworks\Rage\Rage.exe" +set com_allowconsole 1 +r_swapInterval 1 g_fov 10 +jobs_numThreads 0

5.  loaded a game, pressed "#" too bring up console (or ~) and typed m_smooth 0

Done.  Finally is working - hope this helps someone out.

! this fixed problem with repeat ingame "screen freezing"/"fps dropping to 1frame" every few seconds on amd cards , for me :

added a shortcut to desktop with the following in the "target" box under properties:
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Bethesda Softworks\Rage\Rage.exe" +set com_allowconsole 1 +r_swapInterval 1 g_fov 10 +jobs_numThreads 0

8x aa, vsync on, all high, stable 60fps @ amd hd6850,4gig ram,phenon ii x2 550
yeah and dont forget to apply this update, apply latest graphic driver (11.9 or newer) + amd rage performance driver. worked for me

Torrent worked for me (on AMD drivers and all). Here are the exact steps I followed:

1. Download the Skidrow release (18 gb), install, apply crack, etc.
2. Download the Skidrow update (1 gb), unpack the RAR file (JUST THE RAR FILE, IGNORE THE R1, R2, etc.) install into main game directory
3. Download the AMD driver update: 
http://www2.ati.com/drivers/hotfix/amd_catalyst_rage_performance_driver.exe
4.Update DirectX by going into the "directx" folder in the install directory and clicking the .exe file
5. Game runs perfectly, great torrent!
